titleStmt.title: C. M. Garriott et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4271

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos E Brantell Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky We your petitioners citizens of Trimble County Would respectfully represent that ^at^ the Oct Term of the Trimble Circuit Court for the year 1863. Levi S Baker a citizen of sd county was fined fifty dollars for carrying concealed a deadly weapon. We the undersigned ^his^ neighbors and citizens ^of sd county^ would ask your Excelency to remit said fine for the following reasons, First that sd Levi S Baker is one of the Quietest and most peaceable citizens that is in his end of the county. Second that under the circumstances in the case we beleive that for the time being he was perfectly justifiable in carrying sd weapon. yet under the strict letter of the Law, he was unable to make a valid defence consequently the fine was assessed against him.

C M Garriott
T. E. Fields
H D Sullivan
Jas Reed
John Totten
Wm Dean
G C Black
James Gill
John J Thomasson
E Y Mcintosh
A J Wright
F M Abbott
